The sample is a so-called bunched sample, prepared in the following way: first nine county seats and two villages in their surroundings were selected (during the sampling process Budapest had a double weight). Then an elementary school, a vocational secondary training school, a vocational secondary school and a grammar school were randomly selected from each city, and one elementary school from each village. In the elementary schools The interviewers had to visit a fourth and an eighth grade class, in the secondary schools a third grade class (year 11).
